Message: tell me very honest opinion about my opinion, because I know it is very bad. And you may want to tell otherwise, But I know it won't be true.

It's crucial for self-improvement to face constructive critique openly. While I don't have your recording, let's focus on positivity. Believe in your potential to grow, and seek expert guidance or practice consistently.
Please don't lie to me, how bad it was and how quickly can I give up.

My intention isn't to hide the truth, but dwelling on negativity doesn't help. Everyone improves at different paces, so don't rush giving up. Seek professional assessment, work diligently, and embrace setbacks as learning opportunities.
Because of that interpretation, my neighbor called the police, you cannot tell me it was good, or I could be arrested, so should I give up now or later.
I'm sorry for any confusion; my comments were unrelated to your performance quality. Focus on seeking objective feedback from experts, build skills, and make decisions based on progress, not fear.
